page.title: 11SHOPPING CHANGES IN HERNEBAY
page.content: Ii 1985 shopping is no longer a leisurely social occasion as groceries tend to be bought in bulk from the large store and kept in a freezer if necessary. Specialist shops e.g. for fishing tackle are not threatened by the big stores and another growth area for the small family shop is in the Take Away food line . One area of the retail trade in which there have been sweeping changes in recent years has been in the buying of food. To cater for the families with home freezers and which buy in bulk large superstores have opened in the area and the smaller grocery shops find it very hard to compete with their prices or the range of products. In recent years both Cullens and Liptons, old established grocery shops have both closed in this area.
